subject: Interim Font Code Standard
msgSnippet: While the Unicode thread works is way through consensus and appears to be the first step in a multi-year process, I m curious if there is interest in
messageBody:
While the Unicode thread works is way through consensus and appears to be the first step in a multi-year process, I'm curious if there is interest in establishing a standard for Unicode Private Use .

I've looked at a few of the QuikScript fonts and see that they are bound to the Latin alphabet or to the U+E650-E692 range. That range conflicts with Ewellic and it would be best to play nice. Any interest in stabilizing a set for current and future font designs?

I see Shavian has conveniently left the range E700−E72F available since their glyphs were fully adopted by Unicode in 2003...

Jayson
